name: fussily
content:
fussily adverb
(TOO MUCH CARE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows an unnecessary amount of care or worry about something that is not important: He lay back on the bed, tucking the dressing gown fussily round his legs. The service is too fussily attentive - we're asked six times if we've enjoyed our food.
More examplesFewer examplesHer coat fell to the floor, and Bunny fussily swooped to retrieve it.He fussily gave instructions the whole time. He fiddled fussily with the clasp on his briefcase.He preferred to be treated less fussily than in the more expensive hotels.

(TOO MUCH DECORATION)
in a way that includes too much decoration and too many small details: fussily decorated See
fussy
